data.description: Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of premium light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! PACCAR ENGINE COMPANY PACCAR Engine Company in Columbus, Mississippi produces the best-in-class, state-of-the-art MX engines that power Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR MX engines bring a new level of innovation through quality, exceptional reliability, and proven performance. In more than 50 years, PACCAR has delivered over one million engines globally, providing innovative solutions and an unwavering commitment to superior performance. Join our best-in-class team today through the following opportunity: Job Description: Data Engineering Intern The Data Engineering Intern supports the manufacturing facility by building and maintaining data pipelines that collect, organize, and optimize plant data from various systems. This role focuses on enhancing the quality and accessibility of operational data, enabling real-time reporting and advanced analytics for engine production. The position will collaborate with IT and engineering teams to implement tools for data modeling, security, and integration, directly contributing to process improvements and business intelligence initiatives within the plant. Skills / Competencies Basic understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and relational databases (e.g., SQL Server). Familiarity with programming languages such as C# or Python. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and ability to work independently. Effective communication and teamwork abilities. Basic knowledge of data warehousing concepts and cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) is a plus but not required. Basic knowledge of manufacturing systems (DELMIA Apriso, Ignition) a plus but not required. Job Functions / Responsibilities Assist in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for manufacturing operations. Support the integration of factory systems data into centralized databases. Collaborate with IT and engineering teams to ensure data accuracy and reliability. Participate in troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues. Document processes and contribute to data quality initiatives. Help implement data security and compliance measures. Work with business to prepare reports and dashboards for plant management and business unit teams. Document findings and present recommendations to stakeholders. Participate in meetings and contribute to process improvement discussions. Education Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Management Information Systems, AL/ML, or a related field. Coursework or experience in data analysis, statistics, and visualization preferred. As a U.S. PACCAR intern, you have a full range of benefit options including: • Competitive salary and 401k with up to a 5% company match • Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family • Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) • Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance • EAP services including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling and more • Global Fortune 500 company with a wide array of growth, training, and development opportunities • Work alongside experienced goal-oriented colleagues recognized as experts in their field Additional Job Board If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site. PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.
